result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle James Spence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 130 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Disclose to any physician the conditions of probation.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Parenting classes deemed by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Kyle James Spence in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Will makes statements regarding drug treatment program.  Court finds the defendant guilty and enters a judgment on count #1.  Attorney Will makes statements. Attorney Scholz makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Court vacates the plea and the finding of guilt in count #4.  Count #4 is dismissed and read in.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

1 year Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 130 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Disclose to any physician the conditions of probation

Parenting classes deemed by agent	

Sign Medical Release for Agent;

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
